intro: Hetaeria pauciseta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hetaeria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, compound leaves with a narrow, elongated shape. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Hetaeria pauciseta is generally herbaceous, with a life cycle that includes a dormant period during colder months.
